intro: [WRONG START] Colderia procumbens, commonly known as the prostrate coldenia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches a height of less than 30 centimeters. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Coldenia procumbens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
